casebody.data:
UNITED STATES of America, Plaintiff-Appellee, v. Humberto LOPEZ-GARCIA, a.k.a. Humberto Lucio Lopez Garcia, a.k.a. Humberto Deno Lopez, a.k.a. Humberto Lopez-Garcia, Defendant-Appellant. No. 07-15219

Non-Argument Calendar.

United States Court of Appeals, Eleventh Circuit. April 15, 2008. Peggy Morris Ronca, Orlando, FL, for Plaintiff-Appellee. R. Fletcher Peacock, Orlando, FL, Stephen J. Langs, Federal Public Defender, Orlando, FL, for Defendant-Appellant.

Before BIRCH, DUBINA and PRYOR, Circuit Judges.

PER CURIAM:

Stephen J. Langs, appointed counsel for Humberto Lopez-Garcia, has filed a motion to withdraw on appeal supported by a brief prepared pursuant to Anders v. California, 386 U.S. 738, 87 S.Ct. 1396, 18 L.Ed.2d 493 (1967). Our independent review of the entire record reveals that counsel’s assessment of the relative merit of the appeal is correct. Because independent examination of the entire record reveals no arguable issues of merit, counsel’s motion to withdraw is GRANTED, and Lopez-Garcia’s conviction and sentence are AFFIRMED.
